metadata.title: CVE-2019-9821 on Ubuntu 20.04 FIPS Certified (focal) - medium
metadata.description:
A use-after-free vulnerability can occur in AssertWorkerThread due to arace condition with shared workers. This results in a potentiallyexploitable crash. This vulnerability affects Firefox < 67.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-9821` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 67.0+build2-0ubuntu1
firefox-geckodriver - 67.0+build2-0ubuntu1
firefox-mozsymbols - 67.0+build2-0ubuntu1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: firefox package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '67.0+build2-0ubuntu1').
mozjs52 package in focal is affected and may need fixing.
